t: Isaiah 21
The Fall of Babylon Proclaimed
The*p burden against the Wilderness of the Sea. As*pn whirlwinds in the South pass through, So*ild it comes from the desert, from a terrible land.

A*ld distressing vision is declared to me; The*ld treacherous dealer deals treacherously, And*ld the plunderer plunders. Go*ld up, O Elam! Besiege,*ld O Media! All*ld its sighing I have made to cease.
Therefore*ln my loins are filled with pain; Pangs*ld have taken hold of me, like the pangs of a woman in labor. I*ld was distressed when I*i heard it;*i I*ld was dismayed when I*i saw it.*i
My*ld heart wavered, fearfulness frightened me; The*ld night for which I longed He turned into fear for me.
Prepare*ld the table, Set*ld a watchman in the tower, Eat*ld and drink. Arise,*ld you princes, Anoint*ld the shield!
For*ln thus has the Lord said to me: “Go,*ld set a watchman, Let*ld him declare what he sees.”
And*ld he saw a chariot with*i a pair of horsemen, A*ld chariot of donkeys, and*i a chariot of camels, And*ld he listened earnestly with great care.
Then*ld he cried, “A lion, my Lord! I*ld stand continually on the watchtower in the daytime; I*ld have sat at my post every night.

And*ld look, here comes a chariot of men with*i a pair of horsemen!” Then*ld he answered and said, “Babylon*ld is fallen, is fallen! And*ld all the carved images of her gods He*ld has broken to the ground.”
Oh,*ln my threshing and the grain of my floor! That*ld which I have heard from the Lord*s of hosts, The*ld God of Israel, I*ld have declared to you.
Proclamation Against Edom
The*p burden against Dumah. He*pn calls to me out of Seir, “Watchman,*ld what of the night? Watchman,*ld what of the night?”
The*ld watchman said, “The*ld morning comes, and also the night. If*ld you will inquire, inquire; Return!*ld Come back!”
Proclamation Against Arabia
The*p burden against Arabia. In*pn the forest in Arabia you will lodge, O*ld you traveling companies of Dedanites.
O*ld inhabitants of the land of Tema, Bring*ld water to him who is thirsty; With*ld their bread they met him who fled.
For*ld they fled from the swords, from the drawn sword, From*ld the bent bow, and from the distress of war.
For*p thus the Lord*s has said to me: “Within a year, according to the year of a hired man, all the glory of Kedar will fail;
and the remainder of the number of archers, the mighty men of the people of Kedar, will be diminished; for the Lord*s God of Israel has spoken it.”*i
